text:
Morning Tatjana...hope you had a good weekend! :slightly_smiling_face:
I don't think the first reel needs to be as sophisticated honestly. Maybe i steered you in the wrong direction earlier...i think if you have a good variety of drawings and throw in a few timelapses of 2-4(?) of your drawings that should give a good impression of your talents. If you work on some simple animations or transitions for later reels (like that person on Youtube had in their reel) that can only be a bonus to make it look more interesting. But i would guess that after a while your work on projects will speak for itself and as you're working your "reputation" through working with a lot of people will matter way more than a reel (at least that's the case for us...i can only guess that it's similar for other fields as well)
Instagram would be more a personal preference i think...it can be useful to get exposure to other artists etc, but as a professional portfolio it's probably not so useful
Hope that all makes sense :slightly_smiling_face:

Hope you had a good one too!

I wasn't going to include all pieces like that :blush: I have timelapses of a turn around and this but that's all. The rest I'm going to include them as static images!

I do have a personal Instagram that I use a lot as a motivator, seeing talented artists works makes me want to give my best too!

Do beginners find lots of work in Montreal? I've heard a lot of people say we're lucky because there's a lot of openings in the video game/animation  industry right now :o?

From what i hear, Montreal seems to be in a good place at the moment / for the foreseeable future in terms of work (for the our film-vfx field at least, but i imagine that goes similarly for TV/anim, maybe not so much for commercials). For various reasons work is streaming in and people seem certain that it stays like that for a while (i only just arrived here in April, so i'm still trying to get a better overview myself :wink:). That also seems to give companies more certainty, so at the moment it's more likely to get a long(er)-term contract - where in other locations you'd less certainty with shorter-term contracts
We just had two interns start with us here in FX, with one of them getting a offer to stay here for a "proper" fx-position which is pretty cool. I'm going to ask them how that worked for them, since i think they didn't get the internship without being connected to a study or something...
